## A bit of math
The standard normal CDF is \( \Phi(z) = P(Z \le z) \).

## A tiny Python example (renders a plot)
```{python}
import numpy as np, matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from scipy.stats import norm
x = np.linspace(-4,4,401)
y = norm.pdf(x)

#plot the normal curve from xlim=-4 and 4, and then fill the area between -2 and 2 in red color)
plt.xlim(-4, 4)
plt.ylim(0, 0.5)
plt.plot(x, y, color='black')
plt.fill_between(x,0,y, where=(x>=-2) & (x<=2), color='red')
plt.title("Standard Normal PDF"); plt.xlabel("z"); plt.ylabel("density")
plt.tight_layout(); plt.show()
